Definition.WordDefinition:
Ungodly \Un*god"ly\, a. 1. Not godly; not having regard for God; disobedient to God; wicked; impious; sinful. [1913 Webster]
2. Polluted by sin or wickedness. [1913 Webster]
The hours of this ungodly day. --Shak. [1913 Webster] [1913 Webster] -- {Un*god"li*ly}, adv. -- {Un*god"li*ness}, n. [1913 Webster]

ungodly adj 1: characterized by iniquity; wicked because it is believed to be a sin; "iniquitous deeds"; "he said it was sinful to wear lipstick"; "ungodly acts" [syn: {iniquitous}, {sinful}] 2: lacking piety and reverence for a god [syn: {impious}] [also: {ungodliest}, {ungodlier}]
